episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of quirky and intriguing topics, including the politeness of babies in different regions, historical security measures in Japan, the peculiarities of food labeling, and the unique waste management of baby songbirds.

facts.fact: Babies who live in London are more rude than babies from the West Midlands.
In 17th century Japan, the super rich would protect their homes from burglars by installing musical floorboards.
According to its ingredients list, Peperami contains 108% pork.
